step_1_context.text: Look at those clouds - it is going to rain. I think prices will rise next year.

step_2_explanation.simple_rule: Use be going to for plans/evidence and will for decisions, predictions, and promises.
step_2_explanation.formula: be going to + verb | will + verb
step_2_explanation.common_mistake: Do not overuse one form for every future meaning.

step_3_interactive_exercises.question: Choose the best completion: 'I forgot my wallet. I ___ pay you tomorrow.'
step_3_interactive_exercises.explanation_for_failure: A spontaneous decision is usually expressed with will.

step_3_interactive_exercises.incorrect_sentence: Look at the sky. It will to rain.
step_3_interactive_exercises.corrected_sentence: Look at the sky. It is going to rain.
